content.body:
# Track a Caller's Learning Journey

The market test depends on evidence that callers are learning. This demo shows you how to monitor every aspect of a caller's progress.

## What you'll learn

- **Find callers** ‚Äî search, filter, and browse your caller list
- **Read personality profiles** ‚Äî Big Five traits and VARK modality
- **Track progress** ‚Äî curriculum completion and learning goals
- **Review history** ‚Äî past calls and what the system remembers

## Why this matters

For the market test, you need per-spec evidence that callers are progressing. This is where you find it.

## Time: ~6 minutes

Use **‚Üê ‚Üí** arrow keys or the buttons below to navigate.

steps.title: Personality Traits
steps.description: The personality section shows Big Five trait scores and VARK learning modality. These are measured dynamically from conversations ‚Äî not set manually.

left.alt: Big Five personality traits and VARK modality scores

right.body:
## Big Five Traits

- **Openness** ‚Äî curiosity and willingness to explore
- **Conscientiousness** ‚Äî organization and discipline
- **Extraversion** ‚Äî social energy and expressiveness
- **Agreeableness** ‚Äî cooperation and empathy
- **Neuroticism** ‚Äî emotional sensitivity

## VARK Learning Modality

- **Visual** ‚Äî learns from diagrams and images
- **Auditory** ‚Äî learns from listening and discussion
- **Read/Write** ‚Äî learns from text and notes
- **Kinesthetic** ‚Äî learns from practice and examples

These are **measured automatically** from each conversation. The tutor adapts its teaching style based on these scores.

steps.reason: Personality traits drive the adaptive pipeline. Understanding a caller's profile helps you see why the tutor behaves differently with different people.

tips.message: Trait confidence increases with more calls ‚Äî early scores are estimates that improve over time

steps.title: Memory Summaries
steps.description: The system maintains running memory summaries for each caller. These capture key facts, preferences, and conversation context that persist across calls.

right.body:
## How Memory Works

The system extracts and stores key information from every call:

- **Facts** ‚Äî things the caller has shared about themselves
- **Preferences** ‚Äî how they like to learn, topics they enjoy
- **Context** ‚Äî where they left off, what was discussed
- **Progress** ‚Äî achievements and areas needing work

## Why It Matters

Memory makes the tutor feel **continuous**. The caller doesn't have to repeat themselves. The tutor remembers what they said last time and picks up where they left off.

This is one of the strongest differentiators for the market test ‚Äî callers notice when the tutor *remembers them*.

steps.reason: Memory summaries are what make the tutor feel personal and continuous. They're also key evidence for the market test ‚Äî proving the system learns about each caller.

tips.message: Memory summaries are extracted automatically ‚Äî no manual entry needed

content.body:
# Tracking Callers ‚Äî Complete

You've learned how to monitor every aspect of a caller's learning journey:

- **Caller List** ‚Äî search, filter, browse
- **Profile** ‚Äî key stats at a glance
- **Personality** ‚Äî Big Five traits and VARK modality
- **Progress** ‚Äî curriculum completion and milestones
- **Call History** ‚Äî past conversations and summaries
- **Goals** ‚Äî learning objectives and tracking
- **Graph** ‚Äî interaction patterns and relationships
- **Memory** ‚Äî what the system remembers

## For the Market Test

Use these tools to:
1. **Identify struggling callers** ‚Äî low progress, few calls, declining engagement
2. **Celebrate success** ‚Äî completed goals, strong trait development
3. **Gather testimony** ‚Äî per-spec evidence that the system works
4. **Report to stakeholders** ‚Äî concrete data on learning outcomes

## Related Demos

- *Launch a Domain in Under 5 Minutes* (DEMO-QUICK-001)
- *Add Trusted Teaching Content* (DEMO-CONTENT-001)
- *Test Your Tutor Before Going Live* (DEMO-SIM-001)
